com.itko.lisa.testing

Class StagedSuite

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.itko.lisa.coordinator.LisaServerObjectImpl
      • com.itko.lisa.coordinator.BaseCoordinator
        • com.itko.lisa.testing.StagedSuite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Coordinator, SuiteCoordinator, com.itko.lisa.coordinator.SyncPointSupport, com.itko.lisa.net.LisaServerObject, TestEventListener, com.itko.util.AutoRefreshObject.Factory, com.itko.util.MonitoredObject

    public class StagedSuite
extends com.itko.lisa.coordinator.BaseCoordinator
implements SuiteCoordinator, TestEventListener, com.itko.util.MonitoredObject
    StagedSuite This is a Coordinator for test suites. It contains the controller behavior for staging the tests within a suite and can be called at runtime for some useful info. A lot of this class will undo significant refactoring and enhancement in a future release of LISA. Use it sparingly. We are publishing docs on this class at the maintenance release of 3.5b for a specific customer need. Please report your use of this class to us.

      The class that hold suite-level event info.

      • getEventSink

        public com.itko.util.GenericEventSink getEventSink()
        Call this method and add your GenericEventSink.Listener implementation to get suite-level events and no others. It's a fairly quiet event queue by LISA standards. You'll get just the TestEvent.EVENT_SUITE* type events. The objects that come to your listener will be of type SuiteEvent
        Returns:
        the event manager for you to add a listener

      • getFailedTests

        public java.util.List<RegressionRunner> getFailedTests()
        This is a list of RegressionRunner objects that failed. You can call this realtime but will not always be right until the end of the test. Call getStatus() to determine that.
        Returns:
        a List collection of RegressionRunner objects that have failed

      • getAbortedTests

        Returns:
        a List collection of RegressionRunner objects that have aborted

        public void destroy()
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Coordinator
        Call this method to ensure that the Coordinator will release resources and not remain in any network collections. It is optional, as it will eventually be freed regardless. This method is called internally by the CoordinatorServer, but calling it more than once won't hurt anything.

      • setJUnitMode

        Parameters:

      • getConfigFile

        public java.lang.String getConfigFile()
        The name of the configuration we are running. Can be a null or empty string for the default (this means that each test will run it's default config), a word that represents the named config to use in each test or the default if that does not exist, or the path to the external config in use.

      • setConfigFile

        public void setConfigFile(java.lang.String configFile)
        Set during init. Please don't confuse yourself by setting this outside of LISA
        Parameters:
        configFile -

      • getRunType

        public java.lang.String getRunType()
        This this suite running in serial or parallel?
        Returns:
        either SuiteInfo.RUN_TYPE_CONCURRENT or SuiteInfo.RUN_TYPE_PARALLEL

      • isPreview

        public boolean isPreview()
        CORE-1084: Preview Mode outputs the test names and descriptions but does not actually run the tests. This method is checked by RegressionRunner. If true then RegressionRunned will output the test case's Documentation instead of initializing and executing it.
        Returns:
        true if the Staged Suite is in preview mode, false if the staged suite will be run normally.

      • setPreview

        public void setPreview(boolean preview)
        CORE-1084: Preview Mode outputs the test names and descriptions but does not actually run the tests
        Parameters:
        preview - Whether to enable preview mode or not

      • configureForLoadTest

        public void configureForLoadTest()
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Coordinator
        Tells the coord to prepare for a load test. This means changing a few filters, setting some cache timeout options, generally checking on things that could/would prevent a load test from working properly (you don't want pathfinder, you don't want profiling, you don't want the root logger set to debug, etc, etc
        Specified by:
        configureForLoadTest in interface Coordinator
        Overrides:
        configureForLoadTest in class com.itko.lisa.coordinator.BaseCoordinator
        Throws:
